intro: Corispermum tibeticum f. undulatum, commonly known as the undulating tibetic corispermum, is a flowering plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae, characterized by its salt-tolerant and drought-resistant adaptations. The plant exhibits a distinctive undulating leaf morphology, which is a key feature of its varietal form. It typically grows in rocky and arid soils, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are adapted for wind pollination, a common trait in plants of this family.
